text:
The previous version of ant that we used (1.2)- and all prior versions that I 
am aware of - used to search up the directory tree from the current location 
until it found a build.xml file. This facility does not appear to work any 
more - i.e. if the build.xml is not in the current directory then the 
error "Buildfile: build.xml does not exist!" is produced.
creator: andrew.doddington@jpmorgan.com

text:
From the WHATSNEW file in the distribution:

Changes from Ant 1.2 to Ant 1.3
===========================================

Changes that could break older environments:
--------------------------------------------

* Ant doesn't search for the buildfile anymore, unless you use the new
  -find argument.
creator: peterj@liberate.com

text:
I'd like to have the original directory available as an Ant-supplied property if 
Ant is invoked from a directory other than basedir . For example, if I have 
foo/build.xml (with "." as the basedir) and call Ant from foo/bar/, I'd like to 
be able to refer to foo/bar/ by using ${ant.initialdir} or something similar...
That should be the system property user.dir which you can access as ${user.dir}.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
